name: snpEff

options.description: Specify config file

Debug mode (very verbose).
Override data_dir parameter from config file.
Download a SnpEff database, if not available locally. Default: true
Do not download a SnpEff database, if not available locally.

Quiet mode (do not show any messages or errors)
Verbose mode

Only use canonical transcripts.

Only use transcripts having Transcript Support Level lower than <TSL_number>.
Annotate using motifs (requires Motif database). Default: true
Annotate using NextProt (requires NextProt database).

Only use regulation tracks.
Only use protein coding transcripts. Default: false
Only use the transcripts in this file. Format: One transcript ID per line.
Regulation track to use (this option can be used add several times).
Set size for splice sites (donor and acceptor) in bases. Default: 2
Set size for splice site region within exons. Default: 3 bases
Set minimum number of bases for splice site region within intron. Default: 3 bases
Set maximum number of bases for splice site region within intron. Default: 8 bases
Only use 'validated' transcripts (i.e. sequence has been checked). Default: false
Set upstream downstream interval length (in bases)
Use Embl format.
Use GenBank format.
Use GFF2 format (obsolete).
Use GFF3 format.
Use GTF 2.2 format.
Use KnownGenes table from UCSC.
Use RefSeq table from UCSC.
Only build regulation tracks for cellType <type>.
Maximum allowed error rate (number between 0.0 and 1.0). Default: 0.05
Skip CDS sequences check.
Skip Protein sequences check.
Do not store sequence in binary files. Default: false
Only build regulation tracks.
The 'regulation.gff' file is sorted by 'regulation type' instead of sorted by chromosome:pos. Default: false
Store sequence in binary files. Default: true

subcommands.name: buildNextProt
subcommands.description: Build a SnpEff for NextProt (using NextProt's XML files).

subcommands.name: cds
subcommands.description: Compare CDS sequences calculated form a SnpEff database to the one in a FASTA file. Used for checking databases correctness.

options.description: Specify config file
Do not report usage statistics to server
Verbose mode
Debug mode
Input format is BED. Default: VCF
Measure distance from TSS (transcription start site)

subcommands.name: count
subcommands.description: Count how many intervals (from a BAM, BED or VCF file) overlap with each genomic interval.
subcommands.usage:
snpEff count [options] genome file_1 file_2 ...  file_N
 -n name          : Output file base name. 
 -p               : Calculate probability model (binomial). Default: false
 file             : A file contianing intervals or reads. Either BAM, SAM, VCF, BED or BigBed format.

options.description: Output file base name.
Calculate probability model (binomial). Default: false

subcommands.name: databases
subcommands.description: Show currently available databases (from local config file).

subcommands.name: dump
subcommands.description: Dump to STDOUT a SnpEff database (mostly used for debugging).
subcommands.usage:
snpEff dump [options] genome_version
 -bed                    : Dump in BED format (implies -0)
 -chr <string>           : Prepend 'string' to chromosome name (e.g. 'chr1' instead of '1')
 -txt                    : Dump as a TXT table (implies -1)

options.description: Dump in BED format (implies -0)
Prepend 'string' to chromosome name (e.g. 'chr1' instead of '1')
Dump as a TXT table (implies -1)
Output zero-based coordinates.
Output one-based coordinates

subcommands.name: genes2bed
subcommands.description: Create a bed file from a genes list.

options.description: Show coding exons (no UTRs).
Show exons for every transcript.
A TXT file having one gene ID (or name) per line.
Show introns for every transcript.
Use only protein coding genes.
Show transcript coordinates.
Expand gene interval upstream and downstream by 'num' bases.

subcommands.name: len
subcommands.description: Calculate total genomic length for each marker type.

options.description: <num> : Assume a read size of 'num' bases.
<num> : Perform 'num' iterations of random sampling.
Each random sampling iteration has 'num' reads.

subcommands.name: pdb
subcommands.description: Build interaction database (based on PDB data).

options.description: Minimum number of AA of separation within the sequence. Default: 20
ID map file (i.e. file containing mapping from PDB ID to transcript ID). Default: db/pdb/idMap_pdbId_ensemblId_refseqId.txt.gz
A file containing protein-protein interations (from PDB co-srystalzed structures). Default: db/pdb/idMap_pdbId_ensemblId_refseqId.txt.gz
Maximum distance in Angtrom for any atom in a pair of amino acids to be considered 'in contact'. Default: 3.0
Maximum amino acid sequence differece between PDB file and genome. Default: 0.1
Organism 'common name'. Default: HUMAN
Organism 'scientific name'. Default: HOMO SAPIENS
Path to PDB files (files in all sub-dirs are scanned).
Maximum PDB file resolution. Default: 3.0

subcommands.name: protein
subcommands.description: Compare protein sequences calculated form a SnpEff database to the one in a FASTA file. Used for checking databases correctness.

options.description: Try all codon tables on each chromosome and calculate error rates.

subcommands.name: seq
subcommands.usage:
snpEff seq [-r] genome seq_1 seq_2 ... seq_N
 -r : Reverse-Watson-Cricks complement.

options.description: Reverse-Watson-Cricks complement.

subcommands.name: show
subcommands.description: Show a text representation of genes or transcripts coordiantes, DNA sequence and protein sequence.
subcommands.usage: snpEff show genome_version gene_1 ... gene_N ... trId_1 ... trId_N

subcommands.name: translocReport
subcommands.description: Create a translocations report (from VCF file).

options.description: Report only one transcript (used for debugging).
Create output SVG files for each translocation in 'path' (set to empty to disable). Default ''
Output report file name. Default: translocations_report.html
